MINUTES OF THE SITTING OF 9 MARCH 2016 IN THE CHAIR: Martin SCHULZ President 1. Opening of the sitting The sitting opened at 9.05. 2. Delegated acts (Rule 105(6)) The following draft delegated acts had been forwarded to Parliament: — Commission Delegated Regulation supplementing Regulation (EU) No 596/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down regulatory technical standards on the criteria, the procedure and the requirements for establishing an accepted market practice and the requirements for maintaining it, terminating it or modifying the conditions for its acceptance (C(2016)01087 — 2016/2597(DEA)) Deadline for lodging objections: 1 one month from the date of receipt of 26 February 2016 referred to responsible: ECON — Commission Delegated Regulation amending Council Regulation (EC) No 673/2005 establishing additional customs duties on imports of certain products originating in the United States of America (C(2016)01092 — 2016/2598(DEA)) Deadline for lodging objections: 2 months from the date of receipt of 26 February 2016 referred to responsible: INTA — Commission Delegated Regulation supplementing Regulation (EU) No 648/2012 of the European Parliament and of the Council with regard to regulatory technical standards on the clearing obligation (C(2016)01165 — 2016/2601(DEA)) Deadline for lodging objections: 1 one month from the date of receipt of 1 March 2016 referred to responsible: ECON — Commission Delegated Regulation supplementing Regulation (EU) No 596/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council with regard to regulatory technical standards for the content of notifications to be submitted to com- petent authorities and the compilation, publication and maintenance of the list of notifications (C(2016)01224 — 2016/2602(DEA)) Deadline for lodging objections: 1 one month from the date of receipt of 1 March 2016 referred to responsible: ECON — Commission Delegated Regulation supplementing Regulation (EU) No 596/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council with regard to regulatory technical standards for the conditions applicable to buy-back programmes and stabilisation measures (C(2016)01357 — 2016/2614(DEA)) Deadline for lodging objections: 1 one month from the date of receipt of 8 March 2016 referred to responsible: ECON C 156/180 EN 18.5.2017 Official Journal of the European Union Wednesday 9 March 2016

3. Implementing measures (Rule 106) The following draft implementing measures falling under the regulatory procedure with scrutiny had been forwarded to Parliament: — Commission Directive amending Directive 2006/126/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on driving licences (D043528/02 — 2016/2612(RPS) — deadline: 8 June 2016) referred to responsible: TRAN — Commission Regulation on the technical specification for interoperability relating to the control-command and signalling subsystems of the rail system in the European Union (D043613/04 — 2016/2595(RPS) — deadline: 24 May 2016) referred to responsible: TRAN — Commission Regulation amending Regulation (EU) No 452/2014 as regards the removal of templates for the authorisations issued to third country operators and for the associated specifications (D043875/01 — 2016/2603(RPS) — deadline: 2 June 2016) referred to responsible: TRAN — Commission Regulation amending Annex IV to Regulation (EC) No 396/2005 of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards Streptomyces K61 (formerly S. griseoviridis), Candida oleophila strain O, FEN 560 (also called fenugreek or fenugreek seed powder), Methyl decanoate (CAS 110-42-9), Methyl octanoate (CAS 111-11-5) and Terpenoid blend QRD 460 (D044028/02 — 2016/2613(RPS) — deadline: 9 May 2016) referred to responsible: ENVI 4. Transfers of appropriations In accordance with Article 27(3) of the Financial Regulation, the Committee on Budgets had approved transfer of appro- priations DEC 01/2016 by the European Commission. In accordance with Article 27(4) of the Financial Regulation, the Council of the European Union had informed the budgetary authority of the approval of transfer of appropriations DEC 01/2016 — Section III — Commission. In accordance with Article 50(1) of the Financial Regulation, the Committee on Budgets the Committee on Budgets had decided not to object to the European Court of Auditors' proposal to adjust its establishment plan. 5. Documents received The following document had been received from the Commission: — Proposal for transfer of appropriations DEC 4/2016 — Section III — Commission (N8-0018/2016 — C8-0100/2016 — 2016/2029(GBD)) referred to responsible: BUDG 6. 7. Preparation of the European Council meeting of 17 and 18 March 2016 and outcome of the EU-Turkey summit (debate) Council and Commission statements: Preparation of the European Council meeting of 17 and 18 March 2016 and outcome of the EU-Turkey summit (2016/2502(RSP)) Jeanine Hennis-Plasschaert (President-in-Office of the Council) and Valdis Dombrovskis (Vice-President of the Commission) made the statements. The following spoke: Manfred Weber, on behalf of the PPE Group, Gianni Pittella, on behalf of the S&D Group, Syed Kamall, on behalf of the ECR Group, who also replied to a blue-card question by Bill Etheridge, Guy Verhofstadt, on behalf of the ALDE Group, who also replied to a blue-card question by Maria Grapini, Gabriele Zimmer, on behalf of the GUE/NGL Group, Philippe Lamberts, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, David Borrelli, on behalf of the EFDD Group, who also replied to a blue-card question by Gerolf Annemans, Marine Le Pen, on behalf of the ENF Group, and Krisztina Morvai, non-attached Member. IN THE CHAIR: Rainer WIELAND Vice-President The following spoke: Angelika Niebler, Enrique Guerrero Salom, Anna Elżbieta Fotyga, Sophia in 't Veld, Marie-Christine Vergiat, Josep-Maria Terricabras, Nigel Farage, Marcel de Graaff, Diane Dodds, Andrzej Grzyb, Tanja Fajon, Notis Marias, who also replied to a blue-card question by Tibor Szanyi, Pavel Telička, Takis Hadjigeorgiou, Ska Keller, Peter Lundgren, Harald Vilimsky, Eleftherios Synadinos, Victor Boștinaru, Angel Dzhambazki, Reinhard Bütikofer, the last three Members on statements by Eleftherios Synadinos (the President replied that what the Member said would be checked), Françoise Grossetête, who also replied to a blue-card question by Gilles Lebreton, Victor Boștinaru, who also replied to a blue-card question by David Coburn, Timothy Kirkhope, who also replied to a blue-card question by Liisa Jaakonsaari, Marielle de Sarnez, who also replied to a blue-card question by Lampros Fountoulis, and Miguel Urbán Crespo. The following spoke under the catch-the-eye procedure: Michaela Šojdrová, Ana Gomes, Ruža Tomašić, Ivan Jakovčić, Maria Lidia Senra Rodríguez and Ernest Maragall. The following spoke: Johannes Hahn (Member of the Commission) and Jeanine Hennis-Plasschaert. The debate closed. 18.5.2017 EN C 156/183 Official Journal of the European Union Wednesday 9 March 2016

IN THE CHAIR: Martin SCHULZ President 8. Announcement by the President The President had decided, pursuant to Rules 11 and 165, to exclude Eleftherios Synadinos from proceedings with immediate effect and for the rest of the sitting because of the statements he had made during the debate on the Preparation of the European Council meeting of 17 and 18 March 2016 and outcome of the EU-Turkey summit. The President asked Eleftherios Synadinos to leave the Chamber, which he did escorted by the ushers. Members would be notified of any penalties imposed pursuant to Rule 166. IN THE CHAIR: Alexander Graf LAMBSDORFF Vice-President 9. Composition of political groups Eleni Theocharous was no longer a member of the PPE Group and had joined the ECR Group with effect from 8 March 2016. 10. Amendment of the agenda The President, after consulting with the political groups, proposed the following changes to the agenda: — the last item on the agenda on Wednesday the Council and Commission Statement on the International protection of whistle-blowers (item 78 on the agenda) would now only be a Commission statement; — the final vote on the report by Marielle de Sarnez on the proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on the introduction of emergency autonomous trade measures in favour of Tunisia (A8-0013/2016) would be included in voting time on Thursday. Parliament approved these changes. The agenda was amended accordingly. 11. Voting time Detailed voting results (amendments, separate and split votes, etc.) appear in the Results of Votes annex to the minutes. The results of roll-call votes are available in electronic form only, as an annex to the minutes, and can be accessed via Europarl. 11.1. Third part: ‘underlines that the EU budget, as an investment budget, can bring particularly strong added value by boosting growth, competitiveness and job creation in the Member States; draws attention to the need for Member States' contributions to the Union budget not to be treated as an adjustment variable subject to macroeconomic conditions; reiterates also the added value of the Union budget in terms of synergies and economies of scale; emphasises the special situation of isolated and peripheral regions;’ Fourth part: ‘and considers that the contributions to the EU Budget from the Member States should not be accounted when calculating Member States' structural deficits;’ Amendment 41 First part: ‘Expresses its deep concern at the lack of adequate protection for unaccompanied minors all along the route to a safe place and calls for a thorough investigation into the case of the 10 000 missing children reported by Europol;’ Second part: ‘calls for a thorough investigation into all measures and projects, in particular those which have been benefiting from EU financial support and are being implemented with the support of the Member States in the field of migration, asylum and border management, in order to check their compliance with European and international law, in particular the UN Human Rights Charter, the 1951 Convention relating to the Status of Refugees, the Convention on the Rights of the Child, the European Convention on Human Rights and the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the EU;’ 7. Requests for roll-call votes Verts/ALE: § 7 (2nd part) Requests for separate votes S&D, ALDE: § 2 Requests for split votes ALDE: § 12 First part: ‘Believes, also, that better use should be made of the arrangements for political dialogue with national parliaments; highlights, in this connection, the important role given to national parliaments by the Lisbon Treaty and stresses that, alongside the role which they play in monitoring respect for the prin- ciples of subsidiarity and proportionality, they can and do make positive contributions in the frame- work of the political dialogue; encourages better use of the existing subsidiarity and proportionality mechanisms as laid down in the Treaties;’ Second part: ‘emphasises the need for greater flexibility in the enforcement of the eight week deadline for national parliaments to issue a reasoned opinion on non-compliance with the principle of subsidiarity;’ Verts/ALE: § 7 First part: Text as a whole without the words ‘underlines the importance of the agreed “Annual Burden Survey” as a tool to identify and monitor, in a clear and transparent manner, the results of the Union's efforts, in order to avoid and reduce any overregulation and administrative burdens, which should include a list relating specifically to SME's and should distinguish between burdens that individual Commission pro- posals seek to impose and acts by individual Member States; points out that the feasibility and desir- ability of establishing objectives for the reduction of burdens in specific sectors must be carefully evaluated on a case-by-case basis in close cooperation between the institutions, while focusing on the quality of legislation, and without undermining relevant Union standards; expects the Commission to propose, on a regular basis, the repeal of legal acts where such repeal is deemed to be necessary; welcomes in this respect the fact that the three institutions have agreed that impact assessments should also address the impact of proposals on administrative burdens, particularly as regards SMEs;’ Second part: those words 8.
